abstract: Mr. Romney seems to be embracing proposals by House Republicans that would push Medicare costs onto consumers and bolster health care companies and big banks, an economist writes.
snippet: Mr. Romney seems to be embracing proposals by House Republicans that would push Medicare costs onto consumers and bolster health care companies and big banks, an economist writes.
lead_paragraph: Simon Johnson is the Ronald A. Kurtz Professor of Entrepreneurship at the M.I.T. Sloan School of Management and co-author of “White House Burning: The Founding Fathers, Our National Debt, and Why It Matters to You.”

headline.main: Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan’s Budget

abstract: Senator John D. Rockefeller IV, who heads the commerce committee, has asked the Leveson inquiry for any information it has found that would be relevant in the United States.
snippet: Senator John D. Rockefeller IV, who heads the commerce committee, has asked the Leveson inquiry for any information it has found that would be relevant in the United States.
lead_paragraph: A Senate committee is seeking information from British investigators about Rupert Murdoch’s News Corporation, asking for anything in the inquiry into phone hacking suggesting that American citizens were involved or that United States laws were broken.

headline.main: Senate Panel Seeks Information From British Inquiry on News Corp.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation
